name: Sao Paulo
hint: Brazil's largest city and the most populous city in South America, a major financial center

name: Buenos Aires
hint: The capital of Argentina, known for tango, European-style architecture, and vibrant culture

name: Lima
hint: The capital of Peru, a coastal desert city that was the center of the Spanish colonial empire in South America

name: Bogota
hint: The capital of Colombia, one of the highest capital cities in the world at 2,640 meters elevation

name: Rio de Janeiro
hint: Brazil's second-largest city, famous for Christ the Redeemer, Copacabana beach, and Carnival

name: Santiago
hint: The capital of Chile, set in a valley surrounded by the snow-capped Andes and the Chilean Coastal Range

name: Caracas
hint: The capital of Venezuela, located in a mountain valley near the Caribbean coast

name: Quito
hint: The capital of Ecuador, the highest official capital city in the world, sitting near the equator

name: Montevideo
hint: The capital of Uruguay, located on the northern shore of the Rio de la Plata estuary

name: La Paz
hint: Bolivia's seat of government, the highest administrative capital in the world at over 3,600 meters

name: Brasilia
hint: Brazil's planned capital city, designed by Oscar Niemeyer, shaped like an airplane from above

name: Medellin
hint: Colombia's second-largest city, known as the City of Eternal Spring for its pleasant climate
